relevant_findings.general: Pleasant elderly woman. Alert and oriented x 3, in no acute distress.
relevant_findings.HEENT: Normocephalic/atraumatic, extraocular movements intact, pupils equal, round, and reactive to light, dry mucous membranes.
relevant_findings.cardiac: Regular rate and rhythm, normal heart sounds S1 & S2, no gallops or rubs.
relevant_findings.lungs: Decreased breath sounds at bases, otherwise clear.
relevant_findings.abdomen: Bowel sounds present, soft, tenderness to palpation in epigastrium and left upper quadrant, no rebound or guarding, no appreciable hepatosplenomegaly.

ultrasound.pancreas: Imaged portion appears within normal limits, without masses or pancreatic ductal dilation.

kidneys.findings: Normal cortical echogenicity and corticomedullary differentiation, no evidence of masses, stones, or hydronephrosis.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Liver masses have increased in size compared to previous CT imaging.
